text:
Has anyone seen a build error like this before?
```In file included from /opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/linux/byteorder/little_endian.h:13:0,
                 from /opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/asm/byteorder.h:5,
                 from /opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/linux/perf_event.h:20,
                 from libbpf.c:36:
/opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/linux/swab.h:161:1: error: unknown type name ‘__always_inline’
 static __always_inline __u16 __swab16p(const __u16 *p)
 ^
/opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/linux/swab.h:161:30: error: expected ‘=’, ‘,’, ‘;’, ‘asm’ or ‘__attribute__’ before ‘__swab16p’
 static __always_inline __u16 __swab16p(const __u16 *p)
                              ^
/opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/linux/swab.h:174:1: error: unknown type name ‘__always_inline’
 static __always_inline __u32 __swab32p(const __u32 *p)```

elements.text: Has anyone seen a build error like this before?

In file included from /opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/linux/byteorder/little_endian.h:13:0,
                 from /opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/asm/byteorder.h:5,
                 from /opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/linux/perf_event.h:20,
                 from libbpf.c:36:
/opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/linux/swab.h:161:1: error: unknown type name ‘__always_inline’
 static __always_inline __u16 __swab16p(const __u16 *p)
 ^
/opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/linux/swab.h:161:30: error: expected ‘=’, ‘,’, ‘;’, ‘asm’ or ‘__attribute__’ before ‘__swab16p’
 static __always_inline __u16 __swab16p(const __u16 *p)
                              ^
/opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/linux/swab.h:174:1: error: unknown type name ‘__always_inline’
 static __always_inline __u32 __swab32p(const __u32 *p)

text: I haven't, but googling the error message I see many references to alpine/musl, so I guess that's something specific to glibc which is used unconditionally also for musl

elements.text: I haven't, but googling the error message I see many references to alpine/musl, so I guess that's something specific to glibc which is used unconditionally also for musl

text: Ok, good point, I should have google'd this first :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Ok, good point, I should have google'd this first

text: Got it, libbpf needs to be patched to have `#include <linux/stddef.h>` due to some silliness in the kernel headers

elements.text: Got it, libbpf needs to be patched to have
due to some silliness in the kernel headers
